meanings.definition: To jump or spring a long way, to a great height, or with great force.
meanings.sent1: The frog was leaping over the lily pads.
meanings.sent2: The athlete was leaping over the hurdles effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The kangaroo was leaping around the zoo, entertaining the visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was leaping with joy when she saw her long-lost friend.
meanings.sent5: The flames were leaping high into the night sky, fueled by the strong wind.

meanings.definition: A sudden or rapid movement or transition.
meanings.sent1: The sudden leaping of the cat startled the birds.
meanings.sent2: The leaping of the fish out of the water was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent3: The leaping of the squirrel from tree to tree was like a circus act.
meanings.sent4: The leaping of ideas in his mind made it hard to focus on one thing.
meanings.sent5: The leaping of the flames from the fireplace lit up the room with warmth.
